attributes.comment:
I would like to strongly voice my disapproval of fee increases associated with
international adoptions. The fees already collected are more than significant and
make the adoption of children internaionally VERY financially burdensom. The
costs are currently prohibiting some couples from persuing this alternative as a
means to grow there families and leave it as an option for only the upper-class &
exorbitantly wealthy. It is the middle class who can not afford exhaustive infertility
treatment who often persue this means and the others (like us) are trying to follow
our hearts and philanthropic calling to provide children in impoverished countries
with a chance to succeed in life. And lastly, I can't understand how it could
possibly cost more than the fees aready collected to fingerprint individuals and
submit an application. Please re-consider this increase and help keep
international adoption a feasible alternative to growing beautifully diverse American
families.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Amanda C. McGlothlin
